description: From Middle English scathel (“harmful”), from Old English *sceaþol, from Proto-Germanic *skaþulaz (“harmful”), equivalent to scathe +‎ -el. Cognate with Old High German scadel (“injurious, harmful”), Gothic 𐍃𐌺𐌰𐌸𐌿𐌻𐍃 (skaþuls, “injurious, wicked”).

adjectives.description: scaddle (comparative more scaddle, superlative most scaddle)

entries.meaning: (UK, dialectal or obsolete) Wild, mischievous, thievish.
(UK, dialectal or obsolete, chiefly of animals) Timid, nervous, skittish.
